paper_metadata.title: MAIN TEXT
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: The paper discusses the TTR Ala97Ser mutation in Taiwanese patients with hereditary transthyretin-related amyloidosis (ATTR), detailing clinical presentations, penetrance data, and individual patient information.

patients.phenotype: Hereditary transthyretin-related amyloidosis (ATTR) with various symptoms including peripheral neuropathy, gastrointestinal issues, and cardiac involvement.

individual_records.phenotype_details: Progressive tingling, occasional throbbing pain, paresthesia in feet, walking difficulty.
individual_records.evidence_sentence: All patients gradually developed peripheral neuropathy, including progressive tingling, occasional throbbing/shooting pain, or paresthesia/dysesthesia in the feet.
In contrast, patient 2 had a normal nerve conduction study at the age of 37.

individual_records.phenotype_details: Developed higher degree AV block or complete BBB.
individual_records.evidence_sentence: The patients had developed higher degree AV block or complete BBB during the observation period.
Bilateral carpal tunnel syndromes were detected in patients 4, 6 and 8.
Cardiac involvement was common and could lead to symptoms of heart failure.

individual_records.phenotype_details: Positive for Congo red staining in colonic tissue biopsy.
individual_records.evidence_sentence: Colonic tissue biopsies were positive for Congo red staining in patients 6 and 7.

individual_records.phenotype_details: Symptoms of heart failure and elevated BNP levels.
individual_records.evidence_sentence: Patients 1, 5 and 7 presented with elevated brain natriuretic peptide (BNP) at levels up to 200, 108, and 232 pg/ml.
Cardiac involvement was common and could lead to symptoms of heart failure.

functional_data.summary: The TTR Ala97Ser mutation leads to amyloid fibril deposition, causing various clinical manifestations.

variants.segregation_data: The mutation segregates with disease in families, as family members with similar symptoms were observed in six patients (6/8, 75%).
variants.additional_notes: The study highlights the importance of early diagnosis and recognition of symptoms for effective management.
key_quotes: This study broadens the recognition of the initial signs and symptoms, including cardiographic findings and longitudinal manifestations in Taiwanese individuals with ATTR Ala97Ser mutation.

tables_processed.table_caption: Clinical course of patients with ATTR Ala97Ser mutation

extraction_metadata.notes: The extraction was straightforward as the paper focused on the TTR Ala97Ser mutation.
